attributes.action: PM must serve a full term to receive public duty cost allowance
attributes.additional_details: It is unjust that a prime minister who serves for just 45 days can receive this allowance for life when they chose to resign from government.
attributes.background: A Prime Minister must serve the country for a minimum period to benefit from the generosity of the public duty cost allowance.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

estrict Public Duties Cost allowance to Prime Ministers who won an election: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/625646

Introduce a three month "qualifying period" for Prime Minister PDCA eligibility: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/625990

Only allow former PMs to draw on the PDCA after a minimum 1-year service: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/626194
